benchmark_details.name: Meet Your New Client: Writing Reports for AI – Benchmarking Information Loss in Market Research Deliverables
benchmark_details.overview: This study quantifies the information loss that occurs when documents are converted to Markdown for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). It compares how well documents in PDF and PPTX formats can be used by large language models to answer factual questions, introducing an end-to-end benchmark and a corpus of 41 PPTX documents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate information loss during document ingestion into retrieval-augmented generation systems and provide guidance for delivering AI-ready reports.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Information loss may occur in the conversion process, particularly from complex layout elements.

data.source: 41 PPTX documents sourced from GitHub repositories and Q Agentur für Forschung.
data.annotation: Manual annotation of questions and verifying ground truth answers.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated as the sum of correct answers divided by the total number of questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of the document conversion and questioning process.
methodology.baseline_results: Best configuration achieves accuracy of 79% as reported in FinanceBench.
methodology.validation: Results validated through comparison with human-annotated ground truth.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Reports cover a range of topics from different market fields, ensuring diverse content.
